activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A. Gillingham

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for David A. Gillingham
Current: 34059 Meridian Street, Muscoda, WI 53573 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: UNKNOWN,

Defendant must be at his residence from 6 PM to 5 AM.
Not to be on the premises/no contact of 510 S Cairns Street. Richland Center, WI.
Sentencing hearing on January 19, 2023 at 11:00 am.

11:09 AM 2021CF000073, 2021CF000154, 2022CF000020, 2022CF000097, 2022CF000101 - Defendant David A. Gillingham in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt states that they are prepared to enter a plea on 2021CF000073, 2022CF000101 and asking for a presentence investigation. Attorney Harper states that all others will be dismissed and read in. Attorney Bartelt state that they will be enter a plea on 21CF73; count 1 and 22CF101; count 1, 2 and 5. Court goes over the defendant rights. Court finds a factual basis. Defendant enters a guilty plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

21CF73; count 1 - Court orders a PSI

22CF101; count 1, 2  and 5 -  Court orders a PSI

All other cases and counts will be dismissed and read in. 

Attorney Bartelt speaks about curfew and request that the curfew be change to accommodate the new shift change of work. Attorney Harper asks  that the defendant be home during the time of 5:30 PM to 5:00 AM. Discussion. 

Court orders that that defendant curfew be 6 PM at night and end at 5 AM.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:15 PM 2021CF000154, 2022CF000020, 2022CF000097, 2022CF000101, 2021CF000073 - Defendant David A. Gillingham in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt asks for a plea hearing. Attorney Bartelt asks to modify bond to adjust the curfew. (22CF97)  Attorney Bartelt states that the hours for work would be 2:45 PM to 12:30 AM. No objection with Attorney Harper.

Court modifies bond to "Defendant  is allow to leave his home from 11 AM to 12 pm daily to do business in town. Defendant is allow to go to and from work during the hours of 11 AM to 1:30 AM."
Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:21 PM 22CF20, 21CF154, 21CF73, 22CF101, 22CF97, 22CM83 - Defendant David A. Gillingham appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF101, 22CF97- Attorney Bartelt waives the preliminary hearing. DG concurs. Court binds over for trial.  Attorney Harper has filed the information in both cases that will bring forth the same charges. Attorney Bartelt waives the formal reading and stand mute in both cases.

Attorney Bartelt address bond on 22CF97 and ask for a lower cash bond. Attorney Harper comments about the defendant prior history and asks that the $5,000 cash bond continue. 

Court denies the bond modification.

State ask that the defendant remain on his address if the $1,000 cash bond.
Court speaks about a curfew. State asks for 6 PM to 6 AM.

Court will modify bond condition to add a curfew of  6 PM to 6 AM. Defendant must be at his residence from 6 PM to 6 AM.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:11 PM 22CF97/22CF101 - Defendant David A. Gillingham appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated on both cases. 

Attorney Bartelt speaks about preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on August 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:11 AM 22CF97/22CF101 - Defendant David A. Gillingham appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. DG has received the complaint. DG has called the public defenders office and Attorney Bartelt will be the attorney on this case. Court reset and asks the clerk to inform Attorney Bartelt.
Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:11 PM 22CF97/Unfiled cases - Defendant David A. Gillingham appeared by video.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson makes a special appearance. Attorney Harper speaks about the new case and the unfiled case. State speaks about the bail hearing and request a $5,000 cash bond and no contact with 510 S Cairns Ave, Richland Center, WI. Attorney Erickson heard and state that Attorney Bartelt will be taking this case. Attorney Erickson request a signature bond.

Court orders a $1,000 cash bond
Not to be on the premises of 510 S Cairns Street, Richland Center, WI.
